title: ETZ Swap × LizardSwap Partnership: What It Changes for No-KYC Swap Users
keyQuestions: What is LizardSwap and what does it do for no-account crypto swaps?
Does LizardSwap require KYC and what does “no KYC” mean in practice?
How does an instant swap flow work from deposit to payout?
Why can a simple swap still fail or get delayed?
How does ETZ Swap × LizardSwap partnership help users find a safer route faster?
What should I double-check before sending funds on any swap route?
Is a small test swap worth it when using a new route?
quickSteps: Start with your exact direction: what you send and what you want to receive.
Use route discovery to build a shortlist, then choose the clearest flow.
Verify direction, payout address, and any network context before you deposit.
If the route is new, test with a small amount first, then proceed.
Keep basic order and transaction context until the payout is confirmed.

recoveryDecisionTree.title: Swap route selection and safer execution
recoveryDecisionTree.goal: Choose a clearer route fast and avoid common mistakes before you deposit

branches.if: You found several routes that look similar
then: Prefer the route with the clearest flow and fewer surprises
Verify the domain and the direction before you send funds
If it’s a new route, do a small test swap first

branches.if: One route looks unusually good compared with the rest
then: Treat it as a signal to slow down and verify details
Double-check direction, address, and any network assumptions
If anything feels unclear, pick a normal-market route instead

branches.if: The swap is delayed and you receive unsolicited “support” messages
then: Ignore DMs and do not share seed phrases or private keys
Do not grant remote access or install unknown tools
Keep your transaction context and use only the official support path

riskNotes: No-KYC routing reduces onboarding friction but does not remove execution risk.
Wrong address or wrong network assumptions are the most common swap mistakes.
A “too good” route is a reason to verify details, not to rush.
Never trust unsolicited DMs offering “swap help” or “recovery.”
